long_desc.thetext:
The deprecation warnings in 1.5 are showing an invalid stack trace with Opera:
035004 undefined http://localhost:229:6 http://localhost:250:8 http://localhost:564:6 http://localhost:52:2 http://localhost:85:6 http://localhost:873:10
In Chrome it is correct.
I am using Opera 11.50 on Windows 7 64-bit.
Opera is usually really bad when it comes to stacktraces. Do you have them enabled in your opera? Maybe thats the source of the problem.

I have no idea how to enable those. I googled and the option they are referring to (opera:config#UserPrefs|Exceptions Have Stacktrace) doesn't exist in 11.50. There's actually no entry at all in opera:config, that refers to a stack trace.
I have no idea how to get that done. But don't think that we can fix that in qooxdoo therefore I would close that bug.
I don't expect qooxdoo to enable those, but it would be nice to know, so I can check, if the traces are actually correct with the setting enabled.

(In reply to comment #4) > I don't expect qooxdoo to enable those, but it would be nice to know, so I can > check, if the traces are actually correct with the setting enabled.
Maybe you should ask on Stackoverflow or the opera guys how to enable that.
